value.0: A warning: do not delevel RDDs! Their stats will mess up. Do a full rebuild, which they get for free.
DM: Delevelling PCs

Doing Rebuilds

1. Make sure the PC you rebuild to has not been through the mirror yet, ie: has no PCKEY.
2. Rebuild in one of the following areas: ATR, ATR House, Area 51, Entry, Cooldown Room.
3. You take a PCs gear, including the pckey and gold, and save your avatar
4. You strip the player of everything, including levels
5. PC logs out, comes back with the new, fresh version
6. You give the stuff to the new PC, but don't give him any XP
7. Let him save and send him through the mirror
8. The PC gets his portals and quests when he steps through the mirror
9. Give him XP
10. Don't forget his gold!

The PC is refused by the Mirror!
* Take his PCKEY and give it back. See if that helps.
* Make sure you gave him HIS PCKEY, and not yours
* If you deleted his PCKEY, do the following:

Making a replacement PCKEY
* Check your logs for the old key name ("acquired GHTY87RT_20071102160734")
* Check the admin tools if you can't find it in your logs
* Copy the name of the item
* Go to the Renamer and spawn a Tutorial/Rescue PCKEY
* Rename the item with the copied name
* Give this item to the PC and let him try the mirror again
* The quests and portals will be loaded on the PCKEY from the database

This (old) PC wants to (un)bind an alternative location
* Take the PC to the Entry
* Use the PC Manipulator on him and choose Set Alternative Starting Location
* Let the PC use the Mirrors

Banning a PC from the website
* Note the PCs account and name
* Go to the ban page and ban him
* Go back in game and select "Flush CDKEY Ban Cache" on the Database Tool
* The ban will now be active in the game
* Without flushing the cache it will be active next reset

Understanding Caching
Asking the database for information takes a bit of bandwidth, so we try to make it as minimal as possible. A trick is to store often used information on an object in the module. We do this with the list of banned people, dms, critters spawning from an area, NPC messages, etc. This is done on reset.
So, if you change something in the database it will not change in the game, as NWN doesn't know that the database changed. Because of this you need to flush the relevant cache. This causes NWN to ask for a fresh list. You do this with the Database Tool.
DM: Rebuilding PCs

Edgar went out, leading a patrol as per usual. They were encountered by a group of giants and in the heat of the battle Edgar accidently dropped his lucky charm. He's pretty unhappy about this, but can't go out search for it himself due to his duties of protecting Lord Hallstein Øvind and the Lady. Edgar has not told Master Øvind because he is afraid of getting laughed at. Thus, he asks the adventurer to do a favour and return his talisman.
I found Edgar's Luck Charm! Let's bring it back.
I returned Edgar's Luck Charm that was stolen by those nasty giants. Hurray for me!
_Edgar Gæirvi's Lost Lucky Charm
<CUSTOM1100>
About Amia
<CUSTOM1105>

Amia Website

Server Rules

Things you shouldn't do...

Calad Varnor, a mage from Kohlingen whom you encountered at the Barrows Lake on the Frontier, has asked that you look for information on the fate of his colleague and for any clues about the Gibberling infestation below ground.
The writings of the mage Thirurmorn suggest that he was not entirely sane, and that his condition might be related to the presence of the Gibberlings. Search for more clues deeper within the tunnels.
Find the source of the strange rift deep within the Gibberling tunnels and destroy it.
Return to Calad Varnor at the Barrows Lake in the Amia Frontier and give him the news about Thirurmorn's death and the intrusion by the Far Realm.

You told the mage Calad Varnor about the Gibberling infestation in the tunnels below the Amia Frontier in the Barrows Lake area. He said he'd pay for more Gibberslug corpses and chaos crystals if he's still there next time you go back.
<CUSTOM5102>[G2+] Maw of Madness (Part 1/2): ++<CUSTOM5100>

A priest of Jergal at the Lowlands Delta has asked me to cull the Troglodyte lair underneath the southern swamps, just to the east of the Delta. I need to bring him back the head of the strongest among them.
The Trog chieftain defeated and its head removed, it's time to return to the Lowlands Delta and speak with the Jergalite priest.
My reward for bringing back the head of the Troglodyte's chieftain from the Lowlands Swamp was ample enough, but that priest of Jergal who I met at the Delta was very strange.
<CUSTOM5102>Reptiles of Value (Part 1/3): ++<CUSTOM5100>

The worgs that usually inhabit the deeper woods of the Skull Crags have begun venturing into the Timberlands east of Guldorand, putting the lumberjacks there at risk. Militia Captain Bennald has asked me to investigate the cause of this migration.
The small Orcwort tree proved to be the source of the Wortlings, which were driving the worgs down the mountain. It's time to report back to Captain Bennald of Guldorand.

Having slain the Orcwort tree, nature should return to its normal balance in the Timberlands, keeping the Guldorand loggers safe. But you can't help but wonder if more Orcworts might be growing, still deeper in the forest... a trouble for another adventurer to face.
<CUSTOM5104>Timber Terror: +++<CUSTOM5104>

The magi Lorvo and Ildrar in Cordor have told you about the wonders and dangers of the Netherese ruin they call the Labyrinth. In order to reach its deepest levels, you must first gather for them the essence of four flames which they claim to be found within the final room on the first level.
With the essence of the four flames of the Labyrinth in hand, you're ready to return to Lorvo and Ildrar in Cordor to find out what happens next.

In order to power the door to the second level of the Labyrinth, more of the flame essence must be collected and returned to Lorvo and Ildrar in Cordor.

((OOC: this quest will be updated when the second level is opened))
<CUSTOM5108>[G4+] Unearthing Arcana: *****<CUSTOM5100>

Having defeated the temporal abomination known as the Phane, the search begins for someone who might know what to do with the small portion of its essence you collected. Though anyone on Amia itself isn't likely to have encountered the like before, perhaps a Mystran of mainland Faerun might... but where to find one?

The wizard Belorfin offered to use a small amount of the Temporal Essence to enchant one of my items with better protection against the attacks of the Phane and beings like it, in exchange for the remaining essence. His offer accepted, I will be better prepared when next I encounter such a creature.
<CUSTOM5108>[G6+] Time Is of the Essence: *****<CUSTOM5100>

Farmer Gilbert who lives just north of the city of Cordor asked me to teach those pesky Goblins a lesson. He said they can be found north, then east of Cordor, hiding in the hills of the Eastern Frontier. They inhabit a cave there.

Having tracked down the goblins' leader in the old kobold caves of the eastern Frontier, it's time to return to Gilbert in North Cordor to tell him of my success. I'll need the High Priest's amulet as proof, so I shouldn't sell it just yet.

Farmer Gilbert of North Cordor was grateful for my work clearing out some of the goblins to the northeast and killing their leader. Though a new one will rise in time, that's a job for the next adventurer to come along...
<CUSTOM5114>A Farmer's Favor: +<CUSTOM5100>

Having chosen to help Cordorian Guard Enrik by investigating the spider den in Cape Slakh, my path rests to the southwest of Cordor. He's asked that I get a general sense of their numbers by making my way deep within the heart of the cave they inhabit.

Reaching the heart of the spiders' den in Cape Slakh, dozens of egg sacs were found just waiting to hatch. It's time to report my findings to Guard Enrik, just inside the entrance to the West Coast outskirts of Cordor.

Guard Enrik of Cordor has left me with a choice; gather up some lynx blood from the Swamplight Lynx in the Lowlands Swamp area and bring it back to the Cape Slakh spider den to feed to the eggs, or simply return to the den and destroy the eggs instead, risking the ire of the spiders there. The Lynx only come out at night, I've been told.
Having made my choice between gathering the lynx blood or making a break for the spider's den directly, it's now time to deal with the egg sacs in the heart of the Cape Slakh spiders' den.

The egg sacks in Cape Slakh have been dealt with, one way or the other, and it's now time to return to Guard Enrik in the West Coast outskirts of Cordor. One can only hope he'll be satisfied with the chosen resolution.
Guard Enrik of Cordor provided me with a small stipend for having helped to keep the travelers of the western roads safe from the next generation of Cape Slakh spiders.
<CUSTOM5114>Children of Webs: +<CUSTOM5100>

After having been nearly run down in the streets of Cordor by a courier in a hurry, the idea sprung forth that work might be found at the Commonwealth Courier Company office the courier emerged from, located at the eastern edge of the East Cordor square.

Pickering, the proprietor of the Commonwealth Courier Company in East Cordor, has hired me to run deliveries all across Cordor to learn the layout of the city and earn my keep. If I get lost, I should check back in with him for more detailed directions.
All the packages from the Commonwealth Courier Company have been delivered and it's time to return to their office in East Cordor.

Pickering at the Commonwealth Courier Company paid me a decent wage for running deliveries across the city of Cordor, and I learned my way around and earned some basic adventuring supplies at the same time. Not a bad day's work.
<CUSTOM5114>Courier for A Day: +<CUSTOM5100>
It would seem that something in the Western tunnels is spooking the sewer cleaners away from their work below the streets of Cordor.

Having encountered a Carrion Crawler in the Cordor sewers and survived to tell the tale, the ominous slurping and sucking sounds that scared off the workers can still be heard from farther to the west.

What a disgusting creature! Having found the source of the sounds which were spooking the sewer cleaners, it's time to return to the cleaners in the Central or Southern tunnels below Cordor to claim your reward.
With the sewer cleaners beneath Cordor getting back to work after the removal of the Ocre Jelly, it's time to move on to the next adventure.
<CUSTOM5114>Life of a Sewer Cleaner: +<CUSTOM5100>

I met a rather forlorn man in the logging village of Guldorand named Gustav today.  He was lovesick over the loss of his lover, Moradel.  She's in the Skull Crag Crypts now apparently, in the grips of undeath.  I promised Gustav that I would do what I could to put her to rest, even if only for a while.  This should be easy!
Gustav was pleased to hear that I laid Moradel to rest, I'm exhausted now though.  I should take some time to relax.  I really need to cherish the peaceful moments.
I've laid Moradel to rest, just as Gustav asked. Tomorrow I make my way back to Guldorand to tell him.
A Promise to Gustav

Comment.value: I have become a member of the Amia Trader & Craftsmen Federation!

value.0: I have become a member of the Amia Trader & Craftsmen Federation!
I resigned as an Amian Trader.
Amian Traders
I must bring this strange book to the Thykkvi monastery. The priest, his name is Thorghir, collects obscure tomes.
I delivered a strange tome to the Thykkvi monastery.
Book Service
Mr Halley of the Caraigh lighthouse misses one of the lenses of his light device. He suspects that the Scare Crows have stolen it. At night they roost on a rock cliff in the Cloudfen Grove.
I found Mr Halley's lense. Back to the Lighthouse!
I got a handsome reward for returning Mr Halley's lighthouse lense.
Caraigh: A Murder of Crows
The blue wizard in Caraigh asked me to find some bone for him in the Barrows West of his tower.
I found some bone material. Back to the wizard tower!
I returned to the blue wizard with the Barrow's bone stuff. He told me to return to him if I need another job.
Caraigh: Aiden the Blue
I need to find a horrible hound that haunts the forests around Blackmoor Keep during night.
I killed that doggy and took his head with me as proof. Back to the asylum, I guess.
I killed the Blackmoor Hound. Well, one of them.
Caraigh: Blackmoor's Dog
Jard in Caiden's Mill asked me to hunt down a water troll that's lurking under bridges in the forests around Castle Blackmoor.
I slayed the treacherous Troll under the bridge. It need to bring its ugly (even to Troll standards!) head back to Jard.
I slayed the treacherous Troll under the bridge in Caraigh.
Caraigh: Under the Bridge
Menial tasks in Ultrinnan.... and there was I thinking that being Drow was all about being mean and walking around in a smart uniform.
Chores

Cordorian Guard Mage Phillipi was looking for adventurers to help fight against the orcs to the north.  Usually, the orcs are not a problem, as they are disorganized and attack with blind rage.  However, Cordorian Guard Mage Phillipi's scouts told him that they have a leader now.  I'll get a reward if I bring back this chosen one's head.
I've slain the vile Chosen of Gruumsh, and brought his head back to Cordorian Guard Mage Phillipi as proof.  He offered me a reward, but I've always known that a good deed done is reward enough.

I've returned triumphantly to Cordorian Guard Mage Phillipi with the foul orc's head in my bags.  He seemed pleased that I was able to slay the Chosen of Gruumsh and gave me a nice reward.  Now, what to spend it on...?
Chosen Orc's Head

The Scientific Dragon in Mt Firth is looking for a tome called "How I Learnt To Be An Arch Mage Overnight". 

I wonder if I can find this tome on this illiterate island, really.
I delivered the tome "How I Learnt To Be An Arch Mage Overnight" to the Scientific Dragon.
Dragon Servant

I need to clean up our idol of Eilistraee to keep it in good shape. Let's go and fetch the bucket of water at the other side of the pool. There's a pump over there, and buckets.

After that I need some soap weed and then I can clean the idol.

I have to visit Semlion the trader, he's somewhere around the cart and ferry station, to pick up an item. I need to show him Elrienia's order.

The safest way to reach him is by the ferry leaving from Kampo's Storehouse, just north of the Shrine.
I received Semlion's package for Elrienia. Back to the Shrine!
I delivered Elrienia's package. Let's see if she has another job.
I have a package of herbs for Sister Hannah in the Salandran Temple. I can reach the temple by the ferry just outside the Shrine.

I have a batch of eggs for Bemmi the Baker. You can take the hidden road through the trees and go south towards the Forest. Continue southeards and you will reach Bendir Dale. You'll find Bemmi near the windmill. Stay on the roads and you will be safe!
I delivered all Elrienia's packages. Let's go back and tell her.
Elrienia's chores haven been done.
Clean!
Elrienia's Chores

A fisherman called Paddy asked me to help him repairing his stranded ship. I have to collect the following items and return them to Pearldiver's Peak.

- Iron spikes
- A light hammer
- Elmwood planks
- A bolt of cloth
- A bucket of pitch
- An iron anchor
- A bundle of hemp rope

Mmmm. I need a smith for the anchor, I guess.
I brought Paddy in  Pearldiver's Peak all the things he needs to repair his ship!
I offered Paddy to destroy the pirates threatening his ship.
I helped Paddy to repair his ship, killed a lot of the pirates threatening his trade, and escaped from their base by touching a magic mirror. What an adventure!
Fisherman's Friend
Zeek the Smith wants me to get some metal from that ruined golem in Pearldiver's Peak north of Wharftown. He'll forge an anchor out of it.
Zeek made me an anchor! I only have to drag it to Paddy in Pearldiver's Peak now....
I gave the anchor to Paddy. Glad I got rid of it.
Fisherman's Friend: Anchor
The Pitcher in Uhm need a chunk of Tar Tree bark to distill pitch from. You can collect it at the borders of the Great Forest east of Uhm.
The Pitcher distilled a bucket of pitch from the Tar Tree bark! I only have to bring it to Paddy in Pearldiver's Peak now....
I gave Paddy a bucket of pitch!
Fisherman's Friend: Pitch

The Highpriest in Howness wants to bake healthy bread. Unfortunately his stocks are rather empty. He needs a sack of flour, a bag of hazelnuts, and glacier water. The latter is best delivered as an ice block. 

The flour is imported by the Thykkvi Monastery east of Howness. You can find the hazelnuts in the Niflwood Forest in the south-west part of the island, and the Firnannog Glacier lies somewhere in between both locations.
The Highpriest in Howness has enough ingredients to make some traditional yet healthy bread.
Give Us Our Weekly Bread
I bought a hunting permit. This enables me to leave Howness and hunt in the snowfields of Forrstakkr.
Hunting Season
Onyx Shadowborne has asked me to look into why his shipments are late from the mines. He said the mines are located south of the city.
I found some sort of factory, and a golem made of strange metal. I wonder if this will be helpful to Onyx Shadowborne.
Onyx Shadowborne gave me some sort of dust in exchange for the metal I found. I'm not sure I got the better end of this deal.
In The Shadow of Shadesteel

Umara asked me to burn some incense at the feet of Nepthys' statue in the Tenple of the Eight Gods. I need to take the road west of Djedet and watch out of some creatures called Whispers. Potions of Mindblank offer some protection, apparently.
I placed the incense at Nepthys' feet. Let's return to Hasrabet and tell Umara.
I have completed Umara's request.
Incense
I need to bring K'ssay Everlast the head of the current Bastion commander.
Mental note: K'ssay Everlast owes me a reward.
I got a nice present from K'ssay Everlast for bringing him the Bastion Commander's head.
You have chosen to help Celestial Commander and lost the option to do the quest for K'ssay Everlast in Actand.
Infernal Business

Ankh'remun's Curse

You've promised Lady Si'neela of the Temple of Lathander to turn the curse that Ankh'remun placed upon the townsfolk. Return to her ladyship with proof for a small reward.

Ankh'remun's Curse

You've turned the curse and Lady Si'neela as well as her townsfolk are very grateful to you.
[This quest is no longer valid]
Lady Si'neela's Problem

Abyssal is the language of demons, and spoken amongst the fiends of the underworld. Wizards and clerics who traffic in beings from the Lower Plane also attempt to learn this language and its blasphemous, obscene alphabet.
Language: Abyssal

Even the common form of Aquan, choped into words and sentences as it is, has a natural flow to it and sounds beautiful when spoken. True Aquan on the other hand sounds like one constant song: it reminds one of such natural symphonies as waves lapping shore and rain hitting water, with a flowing base melody that at times sounds almost like whale song.
Language: Aquan

Auran is a swift, almost frantic language that doesn't resemble normal speach so much as the wind: whether a playful breeze, a howling windstorm, or something in-between varies with the speaker's mood. It is impossible to speak Auran properly when using your voice-box: it can only wispered. Despite this, Auran conversation doesn't have to be quite at all, and Auran 'screams' can be very loud indeed.
Language: Auran

Celestial is a very calm, soothing language, and like Aquan a very beautiful one: every word of the tongue rings with purity and truth. It is the language of the heavens, spoken by the angels and ascended mortals. Some clerics also learn the language, though it is nearly impossible for mortals to master. It has its own unique, highly complex alphabet.
Language: Celestial
Common, also called Trade Common, is quickly becoming the language of choice among civilized nations. It is the most common language used for international trade.
Language: Common

Draconic is the ancient, sibilant tongue of the dragons, spoken by the mighty wyrms, those who would serve them, and wizards and sorcerers who seek to master the arcane secrets of the elusive draconic lords.It has descended from a very ancient and obscure tongue that is long forgotten now. Draconian and Lizardfolk are both somewhat related but Lizardfolk is a more primitive language that bears basic similarities to the root tongue. Kobolds still use it from even before the coming of Elves and Men during the great migrations over 15,000 years ago. Even a few Lizardfolk use it in their dealings with the small Kobolds.
Language: Draconic

The Drow language is a dialect of ancient Elvish. Modern Elvish and Drow have many words in common, and many more from the same root source but a knowledge of Elvish does not enable you to understand Drow and vice versa. Sounds that emulate dripping water, wind blowing through a cavern, the clicking of giant spiders, moans and the like constitute much of the tongue and echo-like inflections are usually present. There are 23 different drow words for cavern, 7 for the kinds of water found in the under dark, 11 for the under dark emanations (or radiation) and 1,284 different words for torture. There are no drow words for selflessness, compassion or joy, as these are largely alien concepts to the dark elves.
Language: Drow

Hand Sign is actually a misnomer as the silent tongue of the drow also relies on body stance, facial expression, and other subtle gestures to communicate as well as any spoken language used by a highly animated speaker. It's not illegal to teach this language to others but by custom is generally not done so few non-drow know it. Teaching it to slaves is punishable by death (for both slave(s) and instructor). Only drow can ever master this language, it is said, and it allows them to communicate silently with hand gestures at distances of up to 220 feet as long as they can see each other.
Language: Drow Hand Sign

This is a slow and ritualized language that incorporates and revolves around many natural sounds - birdcalls, snuffles, whirring wings. It does not give itself away as conversation to those unaware of it. It is essentially for talking to animals (not holding a conversation, but instructing animal friends, etc.) It is held secret by Druids, who are automatically proficient.
Language: Druidic

Dwarves speak Dwarven, which has its own runic script. Dwarven literature is marked by comprehensive histories of kingdoms and wars throughout the millennia. The Dwarven alphabet is also used (with minor variations) for the Gnome, Giant, Goblin, Orc, and Terran languages.
Language: Dwarven

The language of the modern elves reflects their love of music and beauty. It is melodic and fluid, with a hint of the wind flowing through the forest. It is also intricate and highly expressive. Humans use meta-language (the tone of voice, inflection; body language and the words we choose) to convey meanings not in the actual words. Elven speech and meta-language is far more subtle and can convey many nuances not seen when the other races mangle their tongue. Very few people other than magic users can speak Elven the way elves do. Moon elves have developed an alphabet called Espruar. The flowing lines of these runes reflect the flowing nature of the language.
Language: Elven
A language that uses a similar runic script to Orc. It is common amongst orcs, dwarves, goblinoids, scouts and barbarians.
Language: Giant

A harsh, resonant language incorporating subtleties of posture and expression, it has no formal written counterpart. Two separate dialects distinguish northern and southern branches of the gnoll race; where the gnoll packs dwell in the moors, the language sounds decidedly harsher, while desert-dwelling southerners have a greater sibilance. It is most commonly known by gnolls, orcs, Zahnah'deens, rangers and scouts.
Language: Gnoll

The Gnome Language, which uses the Dwarven script, is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world. Human herbalists, naturalists, and engineers commonly learn Gnome in order to read the best books on their topics of study.
Language: Gnome

Considered a slave's tongue, its written component is poorly developed from the Orcan alphabet. Its guttural, harshly aspirated tone repulses most civilized races, so it is generally known only by travelers, warriors and barbarians in the north to rebuke and order goblins about. Hobgoblins maintain their own subdialect that has heavily altered the pronunciation of many words and as a result the similarity is only identifiable to the most conscientious of scholars.
Language: Goblin

Comment.value: Halflings speak their own language, which uses the Common script. They write very little in their own language, so, unlike dwarves, elves, and gnomes, they don?t have a rich body of written work. The Halfling oral tradition, howe

value.0: Halflings speak their own language, which uses the Common script. They write very little in their own language, so, unlike dwarves, elves, and gnomes, they don?t have a rich body of written work. The Halfling oral tradition, however, is very strong. While the Halfling language isn?t secret, Halflings are loath to share it with others. Almost all Halflings speak Common, since they use it to deal with the people in whose lands they are living or through which they are traveling.
Language: Halfling

True Ignan is a harsh, fierce tongue which sounds like nothing so much as an open flame. In fact, when it's speaker is angry or flustered enough it can be hard to tell the difference between True Ignan and the actual sounds of fire.
Language: Ignan

Deep Infernal is a gutteral, almost beastial sounding language. The thoughts and concepts which the language conveys are even more foul and frightening than the sounds themselves. Deep Infernal is the perfect language for speaking of pain, misery, betrayal and concepts even more vile with horrifying precision. Much of the language's profanity seems to 'leak out', such that even those who don't speak Infernal are vaguely aware of what the speach conveys: even when unable to understand them Deep Infernal words conjure up half-realized yet terrible images like the scraps and shards of a forgotten nightmare rising to the surface.
Language: Infernal

Orc, which has no alphabet of its own, uses Dwarven script on the rare occasions when someone writes something down. Orc writing turns up most frequently in graffiti. It is believed to have heavy Elven influence as well, but this of course is denied by most elven linguists. There are many dialects, and words, inflections, and pronunciations vary wildly between tribes and usually a period of a few days is required to sort out and get used to the idiosyncrasies of a new tribe.
Language: Orc

Sylvan is the language of sylvan and fey creatures. It shares many features with elven, and uses the elven alphabet. Some scholars posit that Sylvan is the grandfather tongue of Elven, though elves maintain that the reverse is true.
Language: Sylvan
Terran is a very deep, rumbling tongue that seems to echo forth from the depths of the speaker's being. It reminds the listener of the rumble of gravel and rock sliding and grinding together.
Language: Terran

This is a secret language that is actually a modern version of the old South coast script. Most thief families and a few merchant families can actually pin point their families to the ancient Barony of South Coast. When in public the language is never spoken, although when amongst other thieves, the language is a soft and harmonious language. It can be used undetectably unless there are others present who know it. Most thieves use it, but it has also been picked up and used secretly by spies and some others.
Language: Thieves' Cant

Without question the common tongue of the underdark. Almost every visitor and native speaks it and most slaves brought in learn it over time. This language is mostly made up of elvish, dwarvish, and gnomish words, though since being incorporated into the language most have changed form some and even meaning so while it has its roots in those languages, speakers of all three cannot understand undercommon.
Language: Undercommon
A shady guy in the Anara Oasis asked me to collect some lentils for him. Lentils, schlentils, but who cares as long as I get the money.
I found the 'lentils' that fellow in the Anara Oasis wants.
I deserved way more money for that Lentil job.
Lentils

The Captain of The Barak Runedar Raiders has some new recruits that have gone missing. I told him that I would keep my eye out for signs of them while I traveled the north side of Brogendenstein. He gave me these Portal Gems to hand to the new recruits if I should come across them.
I found the new recruits and gave one of them a portal gem, he vanished after crushing the stone.
I gave the second new recruit a portal gem and he disappeared after crushing it too.

I gave the third and last portal gem to the last of the new recruit and he also disappeared after crushing the stone. When I get back to Barak Runedar I'll have to check with the Captain and make sure they all made it back fine.
The Captain of The Barak Runedar Raiders gave me a very generous reward for helping him find his missing Raiders.
MIA: Runedar Raiders

Mishnaegel, the local herbalist, has asked me to travel to the island of Caraigh and fetch a single petal of a very rare flower that grows in the center of an old shrine somewhere north of Dormenwood.
I've found the flower Mishnaegel was speaking of. The plant was so beauttiful it felt almost sinful to pick a single petal of its flower. I need to be sure to get this back to him.
I was able to return the flower petal to Mishnaegel. He mentioned something about using it to cure some mysterious blight. Who knows for sure what he'll do with it, at least he paid me for it.
Mishnaeglen's Gopher

Comment.value: I have to go into Golag Mur and find the gnome in Guldorand a Gear Heart. It's the ...soul of an advanced Golem.

value.0: A Gnomish Inventor in Guldorand asked me to return a design he forgot in an abandoned workplace somewhere near Uhm. It's easy to identify: it's a big sheet of parchment,  looks very complicated, and says "Plan for a Golem".
I brought Rerigribus the plan he needs to make a new golem!

A Gnomish Inventor in Guldorand asked me to go into Golag Mur and find him a Gear Heart. It's the ...soul of a Golem. He told me that "Mad Uncle Zobiah might have put a few of them in his more advanced models".
Go back to Rerigribus in Guldorand to receive your pocket golem!
I finished Rerigribus' tasks and got a pocket golem!
Of Gnomes and Golems
I need to find a Snake Charmer and kill him with this strange snake summon device.
The Snake Charmer is dead. I took his flute along to prove it. Let's head back to Nes'ek to see the Priest of Hoar.
The Priest of Hoar in Nes'ek rewarded me for kiling the Snake Charmer.
Poetic Justice

Hrolf Hromundsson asked me to avenge his son by slaying his killer. This fellow, called Ljot, is a beserker. He's also rumoured to be a shapeshifter. 

According to Hrolf he was last seen north of the Glacier.
I found Ljot. Now the tiny matter of getting him killed without being eaten by the crazed shapeshifter.

I killed Ljot and cut out his heart, as Hrolf asked me to do.

Maybe I should look around the cavern for his son's remains.
I avenged Hrolf Hromundsson's son and brought back his jacket.
I avenged Hrolf Hromundsson's son.
Revenge on Ljot
J'hianna, a powerful drowess of the Underdark challenged you with some riddles.
I solved J'hianna's riddles.
Riddle me this, riddle me that

I heard about this weird warrior initiation ritual in Ruathym. Young men go to the island Caraigh to slay a a sort of boogeyman called Bugh in the Blackmoor swamp. The creature conveniently regrows or respawns every forthnight, keeping this jolly tradition alive. Killing it seems to be quite a challenge, though.
I slayed Bugh the Bogeyman and extracted a tooth, as Hortim in Wiltun told me to.
Hortim gave me a nice dagger as a reward for Bugh's tooth.
Show me what you're made of
Lord Olvind's hall is empty with out the sound of Sigmunds Music, I should talk to him and see if I convince him to play again.

Sigmund tells me that he won't play again, not until he sees the smile of the fiarest maiden of their people... trouble is she mourns for a lost love. Maybe I can see if there is something that will help cheer her once again.
I've learned that Grunhild cannot smile or laugh again because she has lost all the love in her heart. If I am to return her love I must find all her frozen tears in the icy wastes of Frozenfar.
I have found Grunhilds tears. Now I must bring them to the temple of love so they can free her love from them.
The preistess gave me this potion She said Grunhild must drink it to regain her lost love.
Grunhild has showed me her wonderful smile. Sigmund was right. it does light up the room. I hope this makes Lord Ovind happy now.
Lord Olvind was very happy that Sigmund has found his insperation once again.
Sigmund's Muse
You have helped a poor blind man down on his luck.  The gods surely smile on you this day.
You have helped a poor blind man down on his luck.  The gods surely smile on you this day.
You just stole a blind beggars last 5 gold in the world.  Sometimes it just feels so good, to be so bad.
Spare a coin, friend?
I found some spider eggs... what to do with them?
I'll never mess around with spider eggs again!
The Spider Queen must be pleased with me!
Spider Eggs

Howness' Highpriest wants me to bring a loaf of his healthy bread to cousin Vinni Gerkison.

This fellow lives in Thorstein, along the south-west coast of the island.
I delivered the Highpriest's loaf of bread to cousin Snorrisson.
Spread the Bread
Captain Lowrance's first mate, Mr. Garmin, is willing to pay cash for fresh venison. He suggested I hunt deer in the foothills somewhere north of Osthavn. Past a crossroads, he said.
I have the meat from one deer so far. Mr. Garmin said he'd pay me 50 gold each for three.
I have the meat from two deer so far. Mr. Garmin said he'd pay me 50 gold each for three.
I have the meat from three deer. I should bring it back to Captain Lowrance's first mate, Mr. Garmin, in Osthavn for payment.
Captain Lowrance's ship is well supplied now, thanks to my deer-hunting skills!
Supplies for the Voyage
I need to get some Desert Viper Anitidote for the people in the Lost River area. I have to see the Healer in the Anara Oasis.
The Healer asked me to collect a Desert Viper head. These serpents live in the deserts east of the Oasis.
I have collected a Desert Viper head. Back to the Healer in the Oasis.
I got the antidote! Quick, back to the Lost River region!
I saved the lives of the people in the Lost River region. Hopefully they won't be bitten again.
The Antidote
You've promised Lady Si'neela of the Temple of Lathander to deal with some upstart Minotaurs that harrass mechants traveling between Nes'ek and Djedet.
You made short notice of a group of Minotaurs near Hasrabet and found some wares on them. Return to the Priest of Lathander in Nes'ek for a reward.
The priest of Lathander gave you a nice ring as a reward for your services.
[You already did the old Si'neela quest]
The Bovine Threat
The fat guy in Khalem asked me to look for antique objects for his collection. He directed me towards the West of the island, where an ancient forgotten temple has been found.
I found something that might interest that fellow in Khalem.
That scarab fetched me a nice fee!
The Collector
I have a task: Kill the Priest of Hoar in Nes'ek. He owns a house at the square and always dressed in red. Easy pickings for a guy like me.
The Priest of Hoar is dead. I took his amulet along to prove it. Let's head back to the Anari Oasis to see the Snake Charmer.
The Snake Charmer rewarded me for kiling the Priest of Hoar in Nes'ek.
The Contract
Bergrin Audveig in Wiltun promised he'd split the profit with me if I brought him some iron ore from the mines on Caraigh.
I found some of the iron ore Bergrin wants. I'll just need to bring it back to him in Wiltun to collect my pay.
What?! That louse Bergrin has conned me into hauling this damned iron ore to some blacksmith in Osthavn for him. That's all the way to the island of Ruathym!
All right, I've delivered the iron ore to Osthavn and got the payment note from the blacksmith. Now to get back to Wiltun and get my pay from Bergrin.
I finally collected my pay from Bergrin! I'm glad that's over, but I'm sure that he ripped me off. I'll be wiser next time I talk to that louse.
The Iron Ore Business

I have been asked to send some boys back to their parents in Thordstein. So this is adventuring?

According to the Thorsteiner they went 'adventuring' near the Forgotten Ruins in the north-east.
I have sent a boy back to Thordstein. His parents will be happy to see him return.
The Nanny

Card in the Wiltun Keep told me there's food and furniture disappearing from the cellars. He is afraid he'll be accused of thievery and asked me to go investigate the matter. He says he heard strange noises a few days ago.
It seems a band of goblins were living in the hidden vaults beyond the cellars. I took a head of one of them as proof.
Card in Wiltun Keep was quite happy with my discovery of the goblin band raiding the cellars.
The People Under The Stairs
Laisa the Seer is bothered by nightmares of ghosts and such. She thinks they are coming from the ruins of Aigheshed in Caraigh and asks me to put those spirits to rest.
I sent a ghost to lands of the dead. I should inform Laisa the Seer of my progress.
Laisa rewarded me for putting some ghosts in Aigheshed to rest.
The Restless Death

I have found a dying fisherman near Wharftown. He managed to tell me the following before succumbing to his wounds: "Too late, my life is fading... please, stranger... tell Mayor Keenan in Uhm that the Scourge is back!".
Mayor Keenan asked me to rid the Lumorian Sea of it's greatest Scourge: The Dread Pirate Luchavi. Unfortunately he doesn't have a clue where this evil man currently resides.
I found Luchavi! I am quite sure that Mayor Keenan will be very happy to receive his head on a plate. Now there's just the minor detail of killing him... and then we're off to Uhm.
I brought Mayor Keenan Luchavi's head... let's hope that this ends the pirate attacks.
The Scourge of the Lumorian Coast

The guard outside the western wall of Cordor said he'd dropped a silver neckless a few days ago while scaring off some of the troglodytes that inhabit the swamps out there. He said it's a family heirloom and would give a handsome reward to whoever returned it. I bet those Trogs picked it up.
I found that guards neckless, seems the biggest one made it a part of its personal treasure horde, if you could call its pile of trash a horde.
The guard gave me a handsome enough reward, he really ought to keep a better hold on that neckless if it's so important to him.
Theiving Trogs!

The Holy Man of Kohlingen has told you of a man cursed by his own foolishness, Earl Manfried.  His undead victims now come into town seeking to feed on the living.  You are to locate this evil book, and read aloud the magic words that the holy man gave you, in hopes that you may release some of the cursed Manfreid's blood.  The holy man hopes to use this blood to perform a spell of binding, to keep the undead bound in their location near the manor.

You have brought the blood of Earl Manfreid to the holy man, who even now works his powerful spells with it.  The townsfolk of Kohlingen have rewarded you handsomely for this, and welcome you to return whenever you desire.

You have successfully remembered the correct magical words to speak, and have acquired a vial of the cursed blood of Earl Manfried.  You should take this immediately to the holy man in Kohlingen, that he may work his protective and binding magics upon it.
Turning the Curse

* Asrogg d'l'Elghinyrr - An abandoned crypt filled with undead. It leads up to the Surface.

* Charnag Fil'ashti - A mining complex controlled by Svirfeblin and Duergar.

* Duergar Har'olen - A mysterious area guarded by hostile Duergar.

* Eoul d'Ssussun - Vermin occupies this beautiful cave.

* Gloura K'lar - A strange cavern filled with talking moth women.

* Hiran's K'lar - Gigantic brutes roam this watery district.

* Khi'Sull: Drow heretics and Driders guard this settlement.

* Linddil Naktolen - Lizardman tunnels.

* Loniar Har'ol - Deserted cavern.

* L'Obsul - The Shaft. An inverted garbage pit to some, a home to many others.

* Mu'll Har'ol - Deserted cavern.

* Olog Har'olen - These caverns are inhabited by fierce trolls. Kill them with fire!

* Orbb Har'ol - Spider cavern.

* Rothe Har'olen - Rothe caverns.

* Svirfneblin Har'olen - Inbred gnomish rabble carved out a meager existence in this area.

* To'ryll Lanke - A huge underground lake.

* Uuthli Har'ol - Deserted cavern.
Underdark Areas
Officer Skit said she would pay me handsomely if I went and killed the leader of the trolls lurking in a cave nearby in the Skull Crags. She even gave me some alchemist fire to help fight the trolls.
I have killed the Troll leader and took his head for proof.
Officer Skit thanked me for helping rid the cave of the trolls and graciously paid me for my efforts.
We Can Troll If You Want To!
A beautiful young lady in Djedet asked me to bring her flowers and get a kiss in return!
I found flowers for that beautiful young lady in Djedet.
The beautiful young lady in Djedet will take me to a ball if I bring her a red dancing dress!
The beautiful young lady in Djedet will take me to a ball if I bring her red dancing shoes!
The beautiful young lady in Djedet will take me to a ball if I bring her earrings!
Aaaaarghhh! Women, especially the ones in Djedet, are the devil!
We're having a ball...
The herbalist who lives by the North Road in Ostland has asked me to seek out news of her daughter, who was taken to the fortress of Ostdur by the Everwatch Knights.

I found the daughter of the herbalist who lives by the North Road in Ostland in the dungeon in Ostdur. She tells me that she and the other prisoners have their blood drained for some unknown purpose. I must bring this news to her mother right away.
The herbalist who lives by the North Road has sent me to the Frygtmere Slough to bring her back a special gland from the head of one of the giant leeches that dwell there.
I've fought the giant leeches in the Frygtmere Slough and cut out their salivary glands. I'll return them to the herbalist who lives on the North Road.

The herbalist who lives in the house along the North Road has made a special potion that I'm to give to her daughter in the dungeon of Ostdur. She says this will free the girl and foil whatever evil plans the jailers of Ostdur might have.
I gave the leech potion to the herbalist's daughter. Now I have to inform her mother at her house on the North Road.
Apparently the jailers in the fortress of Ostdur are taking blood from those in their prisons. Why, though, I have not been able to find out.
Where, oh where, can my daughter be?
I need to bring the Quarry Master in Caraigh a note from Lord Wiltun's secretary.
The Quarry Master isn't in his quarry because it's way too dangerous. He refuses to risk his life for a few blocks of stone.
Lord Wiltun's secretary wasn't too pleased about the Quarry Master, but rewarded me for helping him nonetheless.
Wiltun Chores
Ostman in The Thirsty Marauder will tell me a bit more about the people of Forrstakkr if I collect 4 drawings of Runestones.
I collected the Runestone drawings... the Forrstakkrs truly are a bunch of gits.
Written in Stone
